title.rendered: List of Some Famous Backend Technologies Used in 2019.

content.rendered:
Backend is considered as the backbone of any website or software. Without backend no functionality can work and the software will not perform as required.

Backend developers are the people who develop and construct the actual logic behind the working of an application or a website.

A user think that developing the front-end part of the website or application is the most difficult task and that is because the user is directly engaged and interacting with the front-end part only.

But trust me, back-end is much more difficult than what you can actually think.

Just imagine developing the whole logic and concept of how to application or website should work and that too with minimum number of lines of code.

There are many technologies, platforms, languages involved in doing the backend task and today we are going to discuss about a few of them which are quite famous.

Famous Backend Languages, Platforms and Frameworks :

  1. Java (Language):

JAVA – one of the most popular language used by coders all across the globe.

You know why?

Because java is the most versatile language in the coding history.

But what makes Java a versatile language?

Well, the answer is Java Virtual Machine also known as JVM.

The JVM behaves like a platform which can run the code on any computer regardless of where the main code was compiled.

  1. PHP (Language):

If we see in 2019, almost 78% of the websites are developed in PHP.

This language is popularly known for its usage in the making of dynamic and ecommerce websites.

There are many reasons which makes PHP a great language and few of them are listed below:

  • The setup of this language is quite simple and not that much time taking.
  • You can compile and run the code as long as you don’t reach a very high problematic situation in the code making PHP development easy and efficient.

  1. Lumisan Sanbox (Platform):

Lumisan sandbox is a backend development platform with the help of which you can automate your work easily.

Yes, this platform is really helpful because with it you can build your backend solutions with literally no server code.

Obviously it is a paid platform and is not priced high as compared to other platforms.

  1. Laravel Lumen (Framework):

Laravel is a well known framework which is popular for building highly robust backend web apps.

It is a highly chosen platform by the developers while creating web apps in PHP.

  • It consists of a library with the help of which you can quickly send request and updates to the handlers.
  • Very efficient in log and error handling.

  1. Microdot (Framework):

It is the latest framework which is slowly growing and getting the attention of developers. The major task of microdot is creating trusted and significant microservices.

It is not a bag of tools but a bag of many microservices.

  1. RUBY (Language):

Ruby, also known as Ruby on Rails is a language used to develop websites. The best part about Ruby is that it allows you to create basic tasks in just 1 line of code.

With Ruby developers can release the website or application very quickly as it involves a little backend work only.
